body.name: Jasion EB3 Electric Bike for Adults 21mph Folding Adults Electric Bicycles, 350W Brushless Motor, 36V 7.5Ah Battery, Center Suspension, 3 Levels Assist, 14" Foldable ebike for Adults and Teens
features: 350W MOTOR & 19MPH TOP SPEED-Jasion EB3 comfort electric bicycle comes with 36V 7.5Ah lithium-ion battery and 350W powerful brushless motor. Built-in waterproof battery travels 20 km on a single full charge and has a top speed of 19mph.Our adults electric bike combines durability and agility into one irresistible commute.

FLEXIBLE COMMUTE-This lightweight electric bike has foldable handlebar and pedals.Not only easy to carry and store, its compact size allows you to move freely through traffic jams.It’s no wonder it’s the ideal choice for work commuting electric bike.

EXCELLENT RIDING PERFORMANCE-Pure electric mode,Intelligent 3 level pedal assist mode and manual mode (pedaling) mean that you will be ready for whatever road condition comes and It's easy to choose the way you like to ride.Adjustable seat, 264LBS maximum load gets you around from city streets to mountain Trails.

SAFE RIDING-Dual disc brake, 14" anti-shock tires and electronic speaker provides fully protection, bright head and tail light make night riding safer. LCD control panel read speed, battery and miles conveniently, for choose a more suitable speed in different traffic condition.

READY TO GO & RELIABLE SUPPORT-The electric bike is pre-assembled and could save time in a simple installation. Jasion ebike provides lifetime technical support and our 24/7 customer service is ready to respond to your questions.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Top Speed 21 MPH Motor 350W Brushless Motor Battery 36V 7.5Ah Charging Time 3-4 Hours Bike Mode 3 Levels Pedal Assist Mode, Pure Electric (Throttle) Mode, Normal Bike Mode Foldable Position Handlebar and Pedals Suspension Center Suspension Tire 14" x 2.125" Recommended Height 4'1''-5'5'' Bike Weight 45 lbs Age Range 12+ Estimated Max Range 15-18 miles (pure electric) / 20-25 miles (PAS) Suggested Use Commute, Neighborhood, Camping, Exercise Q & A 1 How do I assemble my EB3? - Most of the EB3 has been assembled, leaving a few parts need to be manually installed. You can assemble it refer to the unboxing video. Q & A 2 Is it listed? - Jasion EB3 passed the electric bicycle electric system safety standard test.The standard for electric bicycles covers product safety, battery management system (BMS) and functional safety assessment requirements, etc. Q & A 3 Can I buy spare battery and charger? - Yes, we sell spare EB3 accessories and you can search for Jasion EB3 Battery and Jasion EB3 charger.

reviews.reviewerName: Shirt is an amazingly comfortable material great for the heat.  I used it mostly at a water park but it’s a good shirt overall.
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The bike was easy to assemble, there are great videos online and the instructions are clear and it took about an hour and a half by myself. It rides very smooth I take it 8.5 miles to work every day. Charges in about 3 hours and can go about 20 miles distance. Hits the advertised 21 mph at full charge on flat conditions. I have seen it hit 23 mph downhill and has a top speed (without pedaling) of about 15 mph uphill on a full charge. On less then full charge the speed will fluctuate between 16-20 mph depending on the slope of the road. Pedaling faster makes it go faster uphill but doesn’t do much difference downhill. You practically never have to pedal but if your bike were to die it also pedals the same as a normal bike with the power off so you wouldn’t be stranded. The folding works wonderful it has fit into every car I’ve needed to put it in so far. The lights are bright and effective. The bike itself feels sturdy and well made. The bike is able to ride in grass with ease making it able to go almost anywhere, just avoid large gravel patches at high speeds. Other than needing to store it inside and not riding it the rain as per the manual’s suggestions I have no complaints about this bike and am considering buying a newer model for the longer range and the basket.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Bike, Fast, Fun, Reliable, Battery outlasts me (im 40 with some body aches)
reviews.reviewText: Bad break switch at first? Had to wiggle the break sensor wire or it would go. I didnt realize the break light has a sensor to turn it off and on again.I contacted tech support. Email was a little too slow for me. They responded quickly, Im just impatient so I called. Phone support went through the functions of the bike and figured it was a bad throttle so they shipped me a new one, and a new speed controller?? WOW! free of charge.As stated im impatient so I wanted it to work now! I started checking the connectors. Simly disconnecting and reconnecting. I got to the break sensor in the handle bar lever. Unplugged it, tail light went out, and just like that it was off and running!I didnt think you would want break sensors like it has. then I road it and realized you certainly want the sensors working. I plugged it back in and unscrewed the sensor. Tightened it back up with a little bit of holding it in specific place. Now it works 100% as intended. Not another issue!Did I mention I love this bike? I have been sharing it with my wife. She is just over 5' tall and the mountain bike she got new was too big. It scared her. I thought she was nuts at first. Then I road it. And hated it. I remember everything about the old school style of mountain bike and just hate them. Giant heavy tire that is creepy and scary at times. Anyrate im 6' tall. I just marked the seat post hieght and adjust it for her, then for me.I plan on buying a 2nd one for me soon!Great buy, price, company, experience, great all around. Thanks Jasion!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice eBike - Happy
reviews.reviewText: This review was edited Nov 21, 2023I LOVE THIS SMALL EBIKE!Have 493 miles on my baby now - so gotta share more.This bike is built ROCK SOLID!It will do an indicated 20 or 19 MPHIt will do that for 11 or 13 miles (depending on your weight) - then you will noticeat 36v battery - speed will decrease a little bit) and you want to head home.If you ride at Power assist 2 the whole time - A 130 lb rider can get 20 miles.I can BANK on 15 miles - riding full blast (130 pound rider)I love this particular bike so much - I damn near want to buy a 2nd one!OR the Jasion EB7I have owned my EB3 for 12 days and have 122 miles on it.For reference - I am 5ft 6in and 130 lbs.So far - I love it!It is well designed and well built. Assembly was straight-forward (for an ex helicopter mechanic) - but one thing the manual should have clearly stated - which I figured out in a minute or two - the black bolt that is in the front fork is only intended to keep the forks from bending during shipping - it is NOT used in the bike after shipping - it should be replaced with the long silver one with rounded ends, that is included with the parts.The speed will reach 20 mph on level pavement, and I am getting about 19 miles range before needing to charge (using throttle in a thoughtful manner).It delivers all that it promises - and I enjoy it a lot!I added some bright orange tape to the handlebar post, base of seat post, and rear monoshock to improve visibility.Changed the seat to one with springs - which helped a bit, but the seat it came with was almost as good :)And added a mirror on the left.So happy with this - I will likely be buying the Jasion EB7 soon!The one "complaint" I would have - the designers placed the speedometer in a less-than-perfect position.The throttle on the right grip on the handlebar is 47mm wide, and the right side of the speedometer protrudes about 10mm into/over the twist throttle. When I place my hand normally on the throttle, my right thumb knuckle is touching the speedometer. Everytime I hit a bump that makes the handlebar move up-then-down quickly - the speedo beats on my knuckle (which hurts) so I end up moving my hand slightly, to a position that does not feel entirely natural. I may just tape a little foam or sponge there.I purchased this for $309 plus shipping and that was a good deal. It is now about $299.If you are looking for a quality 14 inch tire eBike for about $300 - I think this is an awesome machine!
